abstract.simpara: This document collects use-cases and software requirements for Discrete Events System framework.

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_GEN_01 Creating object from specfication
sect2.simpara: Framework shall support creation object from specfication

sect2.title: FAP_UC_001 Making changes in the object

simplelist.member: There was a spec for object creation provided.
Object was created from the spec.
Some changes get required for the object.
There is mechanism of making change from dedicated change spec

sect2.title: FAP_UC_002 Creating env root from the spec

itemizedlist.title: Steps
itemizedlist.listitem: Clien specifies spec for FAP environment

itemizedlist.title: Result
itemizedlist.listitem: System creates environment automatically accordig with spec

itemizedlist.title: Notes
itemizedlist.listitem: In ver 0.0.1-3 the env is not created automatically but only on "manually" creating root from the correspondig node of spec

sect2.title: FAP_UC_003 Creating environment with dynamic number of objects

itemizedlist.title: Action
itemizedlist.listitem: Client creates environment where the number of objects can be dynamic. The objects withis the environment depends all other objects.
Client adds new object and connect all currently existing object wiht new one.

itemizedlist.title: Reaction
itemizedlist.listitem: System allows the client to create new connections without using static connections names.

itemizedlist.title: Notes
itemizedlist.listitem: This case is quite often in environments with many identical objects that connects all together.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_004 USER resets system
sect2.simpara: User creates system, runs it and then reset. System goes into initial state.

NOTE: Currently this use-case seems not fully valid because system's chromo can be chanded during the run process (for instance by system's controller). So, no any information of initial state can be presented. Seems we need to reconsider the concept of controlling of system that controller initial data should be controlled system's chromo.

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_STA_01 Transition by default
sect2.simpara: If no transion function nor operation is specified for the state then there shall the following default transition be done:

itemizedlist.listitem: Copying the first input current value if it is compatible to state.

sect2.simpara: NOTE: Earlier one more default transition was used: copying current value of the state to new value. Denied currently.

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_STA_02 Formatting
sect2.simpara: State shall include APIs for formatting to string and from string
NOTES: To String formatting is required for logging. From string formatting is required for specifying initial values for the state (ref )

sect2.title: General
sect2.simpara: Refer to

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_SPC_01 Initial value of state
sect2.simpara: There shall be possibility to specify initial value of state in object specification

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_SPC_02 State incapsulaton
sect2.simpara: Specification shall describe state with high level of incapsulation.
NOTE: this conforms with approach of representation the system as a set of state machines.

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_SPC_03 State named inputs
sect2.simpara: Specification shall describe state's inputs as named entities.
NOTE: This is required for simplifying implementation of transition function (it needs inputs identification) and connections between states.

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_LOG_01 Logging error on construction phase
sect2.simpara: Logging shall record errors happend on construction phase

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_LOG_02 Log file specifying
sect2.simpara: FAP API shall allow requesting the logging into specific log file.
If this is not requested then FAP shall use default log file.

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_LOG_03 Logging in transition functions
sect2.simpara: Framework shall allow using logging from transition function

sect2.title: FAP_REQ_LOG_04 Logging specification
sect2.simpara: Framework shall allow to specify logging parameters shall in two ways:

sect2.title: FAP_UC_ET_01 Transition can use the accessible modules
sect2.simpara: The system defines transition for some state by specifying it within the state. This transition can use the module specifying within the system or super-system.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_ET_02 User can define functions
sect2.simpara: User defines function and then uses it within transition.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_ET_03 User can define custom data type
sect2.simpara: User defines custom data type, and operation for this data type

sect2.title: FAP_UC_ET_04 User can specify state of custom data type
sect2.simpara: User specifies the state of custom data type, ref

sect2.title: FAP_UC_ET_05 User can specify new type
sect2.simpara: User specifies the new type by specifying the constructor that results in required type.

sect2.title: UC_CONN_02 Object has its own input that represent input of some internal state
sect2.simpara: It allows to has the unified interface for states and objects. Morover it solves the problem with access to the object. All access to the object shall be done via objects connection point.
Let's use term "extention" for that. So system connection point is actually an extender. It extends the internal connection point

sect2.title: UC_CONN_03 Connection point can be connected to many connection points
sect2.simpara: An example is state output that can be connected to many state inputs. The alternative way could be to have many connection points for output

sect2.title: UC_CONN_05 Subsystem connections set can be state of system.
sect2.simpara: System controls the structure of subsystem (connections set, transition function). The structure is represented as state - it can be connected to other states, thus the change of structure will cause the activation of dependent states

sect2.title: UC_CONN_06 USER removes internal sub-system, SYSTEM disextend connection points of subsystem

itemizedlist.listitem: Initial conditions: There is system with internal subsystem; system has extention that extend connection point of this subsystem.
SYSTEM automatically disextend extention from subsystem
SYSTEM removes systems's subsystem as component.

sect2.title: UC_CONN_07 USER creates system with several states and an input, and connect the input to states inputes.
sect2.simpara: It shall be allowed to connect system input (extention) to many inputes of states

sect2.title: UC_CONN_08 USER removes connection point - SYSTEM removes assosiated connections/extentions.
FAP_UC_VW_01 User specifies view for interpreter.
sect2.simpara: User runs DES interpreter and specifies how many views should be created and what type they shoud be of.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_02 Client application creates view and adds it to DES interpreter
FAP_UC_VW_06 User specifies base view and see the systems spec
sect2.simpara: User specify that the view of type "base". System displays it's specification in graphic notation.
System displays the following on the base view: inputs, outputs, transitions, states, components

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_03 System shows the DES objects as hierarchy in base view
sect2.simpara: User specify view and the system set this view as a view of root DES object.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_04 User selects different level of detalisation in view.
sect2.simpara: System displays the view as a graphical hierarchy. User selects of full or compact form of view. The full form shows inputs, outputs, components (in compact form), and connections. The compact form shows only inputs and outputs of object.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_05 User changes base view and saves - system stores view data and uses it next time.
FAP_UC_VW_07 User can act to view
sect2.simpara: User acts on view. The system reacts on this and change the view properly.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_09 User taps on connection id
sect2.simpara: User taps on connecion id - system higlight connection id and all corresponding connection ids

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_10 USER selects system with state - SYSTEM displays state, showing state elements
sect2.simpara: The following elemensts are displayed: name, type, trans, init, inputs. Name and type are displayed in header of state.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_11 USER selects system with sub-systems - SYSTEM displays sub-systems, showing its elements
sect2.simpara: The following elemensts are displayed: name, parent, inputs, outputs. Name and parent are displayed in the header of system.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_12 USER taps on name in subsystem - SYSTEM displays sub-system view
FAP_UC_VW_13 USER taps on parent in subsystem - SYSTEM displays parent view
FAP_UC_VW_14 SYSTEM allows to open new view in current or new window
FAP_UC_VW_15 SYSTEM allows USER to navigate thru root hierarhy
sect2.simpara: SYSTEM (for instance Client Application) is initialized by some element within system hierarhy. SYSTEM considers this element as a root. SYSTEM allows USER navigation thru hierarhy below this root.
SYSTEM moves down on USER selects sub-system within current system. SYSTEM moves up on USER selects moving to parent (from menu or toolbar).

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_16 SYSTEM allows USER to navigate thru the history
FAP_UC_VW_17 SYSTEM can filter the connections showing only local of them
FAP_UC_VW_18 USER adds new component
sect2.simpara: New component has no parent and becomes some initial name. USER can create more new components, the names of components are generated uniquely.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_19 USER changes the name of component
FAP_UC_VW_20 USER changes the name of system
FAP_UC_VW_21 USER adds new state
sect2.simpara: New component has of default type and becomes some initial name. USER can create more new states, the names of them are generated uniquely.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_22 USER removes a state.
sect2.simpara: All connection from/to this state are deleted correspondingly

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_23 USER selects type of state.
FAP_UC_VW_24 USER adds inputs to state.
FAP_UC_VW_25 USER renames input of state.
FAP_UC_VW_26 USER changes transition of state.
FAP_UC_VW_27 USER adds connection
sect2.simpara: The connection is added between connection points (not to extender)

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VW_28 USER removes connection
FAP_UC_VW_29 USER changes transtition of system.
FAP_UC_ST_01 USER creates new project
sect2.simpara: STUDIO initially manage DES environment, that provides system ticks. STUDIO also provides some predefined projects template. One of them is default template with empty root only.
USER asks STUDIO to create new project. STUDIO displays to user the list of projects templates available. USER selects the proper template. STUDIO creates the new project from the template.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_ST_02 USER saves the system specification.
FAP_UC_ST_03 USER opens system spec from file on local filesystem.
sect2.simpara: STUDIO initially manages DES environment, that provides system ticks (creates root system).
USER asks STUDIO to open system spec stored as the file on local file system. STUDIO allows USER to select file on filesystem, create system from the spec and add it to the root.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_ST_04 USER edits system by changing parent of component. USER recreates system.
sect2.simpara: USER changes parent of some of component of system. To make the change actual for this components USER needs to recreate the system. USER request STUDIO to recreate the system. STUDIO recreates the system, the USER can see the changes in the component.

sect2.title: FAP_UC_VM_01 USER creates new project and add Visualization Module to it.
sect2.simpara: USER then can create his own regular DES module, the sybsystem within that module can access to DESVM subsystems, create theys heirs and connect to it in order to visualize
